intro: Parasenecio tebakoensis, commonly known as the Tebakoensis ragged robin, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in open, rocky habitats and is often found in the Western Cape region. It has hairy leaves and a branched stem, and its flowers are arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
